title: To amend the Real Estate Settlement Procedures Act of 1974 and the Truth in Lending Act to make the residential mortgage process more understandable, fair, and competitive.
content: Mortgage Loan Consumer Protection Act - Amends the Truth in Lending Act, with respect to credit extensions secured by a real property interest, to revise the category of excluded finance charge items. Amends the Real Estate Settlement Procedures Act, with respect to the uniform settlement statement, to require: (1) separate lines for closing costs, prepaid items, and all other costs paid at closing. (2) at least two days' advance availability of the final settlement statement. And (3) disclosure of all lender fees. Provides, with respect to special information booklets, for: (1) harmonization of good faith estimates and settlement statements. And (2) inclusion of refinancing and upfront payment option information. Prohibits markups and unearned fees. Sets forth servicer escrow-related liabilities. Revises damage and cost, and jurisdiction and statute of limitations provisions.
